questions: Why should you get user approval before remote controlling their computer?
answers: To respect privacy and follow policy for consent and transparency.

questions: What is the purpose of a “knowledge base” in IT support?
answers: A searchable collection of known issues and solutions to speed up fixes.

questions: Why do technicians use checklists for installs and repairs?
answers: To reduce mistakes and ensure steps are completed consistently.

questions: What is the function of an incident report?
answers: To document what happened, impact, and actions taken—especially for security events.

questions: Why do organizations schedule preventative maintenance?
answers: To reduce failures by cleaning, updating, and checking systems regularly.

questions: What is the purpose of an inventory audit?
answers: To confirm what devices exist, where they are, and their current status.

questions: Why is it important to follow warranty rules during repairs?
answers: Incorrect repairs can void coverage and increase cost.

questions: What does “decommissioning” equipment mean?
answers: Retiring a device safely, including data removal and proper disposal.

questions: Why is it important to store spare parts properly?
answers: To prevent damage, loss, or mixing incompatible parts.

questions: What is the purpose of documenting network diagrams?
answers: So others can understand connections and troubleshoot faster.

questions: Why should you avoid using personal accounts on work devices?
answers: It can violate policy and increase data/security risks.

questions: What is the function of an on-call rotation?
answers: To ensure support coverage during nights/weekends or emergencies.

questions: Why do organizations use standard naming conventions?
answers: To keep systems organized and easier to manage/troubleshoot.

questions: What is the purpose of user training during a rollout?
answers: To reduce errors and support requests by teaching correct use.

questions: Why is it important to follow safety procedures when lifting equipment?
answers: To prevent injury and avoid dropping/damaging devices.

questions: What is the function of an escalation path?
answers: It defines who to contact next when an issue needs higher-level support.

questions: Why should you verify backups by testing restores?
answers: A backup is only useful if it can actually be restored successfully.

questions: What is the purpose of a post-incident review?
answers: To learn what went wrong and prevent the same issue from happening again.

questions: Why do organizations restrict physical access to server rooms?
answers: To prevent tampering, theft, and accidental damage to critical systems.

questions: What does “maintenance documentation” typically include?
answers: Date, actions performed, parts used, results, and any follow-up needed.
